questions.stem: Which emerging biomarker best correlates with treatment response and disease activity in MS per ECTRIMS 2024?
questions.explanation: Correct: Serum and CSF NfL reflect axonal injury and correlate with relapse rate and MRI activity; now used in clinical trials. Incorrect: Others lack specificity for MS activity.

questions.stem: What distinguishes paramagnetic rim lesions on MRI in MS?
options: They indicate chronic active smoldering inflammation
They are seen only in NMOSD
They are artifacts from SWI imaging
questions.explanation: Correct: Paramagnetic rim lesions show chronic iron-laden microglial activity and predict progression. Incorrect: They are not acute or NMOSD-specific.

questions.stem: Which BTK inhibitor reached phase 3 trials in relapsing MS by 2025?
questions.explanation: Correct: Tolebrutinib and evobrutinib are oral BTK inhibitors modulating B-cell and microglial signaling; trials ongoing. Incorrect: Others are older or unrelated agents.

questions.stem: A 27-year-old woman develops subacute ataxia and myoclonus after checkpoint inhibitor therapy. MRI shows limbic and cerebellar involvement. Antibody most likely?
questions.explanation: Correct: DPPX-IgG AE can follow checkpoint inhibitors and causes encephalitis with diarrhea, ataxia, and myoclonus. Incorrect: Others show different presentations.

questions.stem: Which monoclonal antibody received approval in 2023 for relapsing MS targeting CD20 with shorter infusion time?
questions.explanation: Correct: Ublituximab is a glycoengineered CD20 antibody allowing shorter infusion. Incorrect: Others are earlier generation CD20 mAbs.

questions.stem: Which imaging feature most supports NMOSD over MS?
questions.explanation: Correct: LETM (>3 vertebral segments) is characteristic for NMOSD. Incorrect: Others favor MS.

questions.stem: A 38-year-old man develops progressive imbalance and diplopia. MRI shows new brainstem lesion and CSF oligoclonal bands. He meets dissemination in space but not time. Which test can substitute for dissemination in time (per McDonald 2023)?
questions.explanation: Correct: CSF OCB substitute for dissemination in time. Incorrect: MRI follow-up or VEPs show activity but not diagnostic substitution.

questions.stem: Which antibody defines IgLON5 disease presenting with parasomnia and bulbar dysfunction?
questions.explanation: Correct: IgLON5 antibodies cause sleep-related and bulbar disorders with tauopathy overlap. Incorrect: Others cause limbic or peripheral syndromes.

questions.stem: What is the mechanism of action of evobrutinib?
questions.explanation: Correct: Evobrutinib is a BTK inhibitor modulating B-cell and microglial activity. Incorrect: Others target distinct pathways.

questions.stem: Which MS agent promotes remyelination via modulation of LINGO-1 pathway (under investigation)?
questions.explanation: Correct: Opicinumab (anti-LINGO-1) showed remyelination signals in early studies though not yet approved. Incorrect: Others are immunomodulatory.

questions.stem: In NMOSD, what is the typical MRI distribution of brain lesions?
options: Periependymal, area postrema, and hypothalamic regions
questions.explanation: Correct: NMOSD brain lesions cluster in periependymal/area postrema zones; MS lesions are periventricular/juxtacortical.

questions.stem: Which autoantibody is associated with Morvan syndrome and peripheral nerve hyperexcitability?
questions.explanation: Correct: CASPR2-IgG linked to Morvan’s and neuromyotonia; LGI1 = limbic AE.

questions.stem: Which DMT carries a rebound risk if discontinued suddenly, similar to fingolimod?
questions.explanation: Correct: Siponimod, another S1P modulator, can cause rebound inflammation if stopped abruptly.

questions.stem: A 41-year-old woman with AQP4+ NMOSD has relapse on rituximab with rapid B-cell repopulation. Which biologic offers IL-6 blockade for such refractory cases?
questions.explanation: Correct: Satralizumab targets IL-6R and benefits patients with inadequate B-cell depletion.

questions.stem: Checkpoint inhibitor-related encephalitis typically responds to:
options: High-dose steroids and cessation of therapy
questions.explanation: Correct: Immune checkpoint AE requires steroids ± IVIG/PLEX; continuing the agent worsens symptoms.

questions.stem: A 24-year-old with tumefactive demyelination and ring enhancement improves with steroids. Which feature distinguishes this from abscess?
questions.explanation: Correct: Open ring toward cortex suggests demyelination.

questions.stem: Which factor predicts better cognitive outcome in MS?
options: Lower lesion burden and higher cognitive reserve
questions.explanation: Correct: Lower lesion load and cognitive reserve correlate with protection.

questions.stem: Which DMT is contraindicated in patients with active hepatitis B infection?
questions.explanation: Correct: Ocrelizumab may reactivate HBV; screen before therapy.

questions.stem: Which CSF profile suggests GFAP astrocytopathy rather than NMOSD?
options: Markedly elevated protein and lymphocytic pleocytosis with GFAP-IgG
questions.explanation: Correct: GFAP disease has lymphocytic pleocytosis with GFAP-IgG positivity.

questions.stem: In pediatric MS, which feature distinguishes it from ADEM?
options: Relapsing course and multiple new lesions over time
questions.explanation: Correct: Relapsing new lesions = MS; monophasic with encephalopathy = ADEM.

questions.stem: Which serum biomarker indicates astrocytic injury and may complement NfL in MS monitoring?
questions.explanation: Correct: GFAP reflects astrocyte injury and complements NfL.

questions.stem: What is the principal mechanism of siponimod?
options: S1P1,5 receptor modulation reducing lymphocyte egress
questions.explanation: Correct: Siponimod modulates S1P receptors reducing CNS infiltration.

questions.stem: Which rehabilitation intervention improves gait speed and balance in progressive MS per 2024 meta-analysis?
questions.explanation: Correct: HIIT treadmill and task-specific balance improve gait outcomes.

questions.stem: A 33-year-old with MOGAD relapses despite steroids. Next-line relapse prevention?
questions.explanation: Correct: IVIG shown effective in recurrent MOGAD; MS DMTs often worsen it.

questions.stem: Which antibody is linked to autoimmune cerebellar ataxia often paraneoplastic with breast carcinoma?
questions.explanation: Correct: Anti-Yo associated with breast/ovarian paraneoplastic cerebellar degeneration.

questions.stem: Most characteristic MRI feature distinguishing MOGAD from MS in optic neuritis?
options: Perineural enhancement and anterior optic nerve swelling
questions.explanation: Correct: MOGAD ON shows perineural and anterior swelling; MS ON is posterior.

questions.stem: Which new oral agent under investigation promotes remyelination by modulating cholesterol synthesis?
questions.explanation: Correct: Clemastine fumarate promotes remyelination via muscarinic blockade.

questions.stem: Which comorbidity most accelerates disability in MS?
questions.explanation: Correct: Smoking doubles risk of faster progression.

questions.stem: Which DMT has the highest rate of hair thinning as side effect?
questions.explanation: Correct: Teriflunomide commonly causes reversible alopecia.

questions.stem: Key distinguishing feature of GFAP astrocytopathy imaging vs NMOSD?
questions.explanation: Correct: Radial enhancement along vessels is pathognomonic.

questions.stem: Which antibody syndrome presents with hyperekplexia, stiffness, and brainstem symptoms due to glycine receptor antibodies?
questions.explanation: Correct: GlyR-IgG causes stiff-person plus/hyperekplexia variants.

questions.stem: Which lifestyle factor improves MS fatigue and quality of life?
questions.explanation: Correct: Exercise reduces fatigue; rest alone worsens deconditioning.

questions.stem: Which imaging metric quantifies slowly expanding lesions in progressive MS?
questions.explanation: Correct: Serial 3D FLAIR lesion expansion quantifies chronic active lesions.

questions.stem: Which antibody overlaps with NMOSD and GFAP astrocytopathy in rare cases?
questions.explanation: Correct: AQP4+GFAP overlap exists, producing combined features.

questions.stem: Which cytokine drives B-cell survival in NMOSD and is elevated in CSF?
questions.explanation: Correct: IL-6 promotes plasmablast survival; hence IL-6R blockade works.

questions.stem: Which MS subtype typically begins after age 45 with insidious progression without relapses?
questions.explanation: Correct: PPMS shows late onset progressive course.

questions.stem: Which neurophysiologic test best quantifies demyelination of optic nerve in MS?
questions.explanation: Correct: VEP latency prolongation detects optic demyelination.

questions.stem: Which new BTK inhibitor showed favorable safety profile but was halted for liver enzyme elevation in 2023?
questions.explanation: Correct: Tolebrutinib paused briefly for hepatic signals; trials resumed under monitoring.

questions.stem: Which syndrome combines opsoclonus-myoclonus with small-cell lung cancer?
questions.explanation: Correct: Anti-Ri associated with paraneoplastic opsoclonus-myoclonus.

questions.stem: Which MRI sequence best detects the central vein sign?
questions.explanation: Correct: SWI best shows central vein within lesions.
